ok.. Can anyone tell me how can I disable Link to prefixing when creating shortcuts?
I don't know if there is a preference in nautilus but you can always change the name afterwards or use "ln -s" directly from the terminal
it says mising parameter
The syntax for ln -s is "ln -s /path/to/origianal /path/to/symbolic-link"
A symbolic link in Unix is basically the same as a windows shortcut
I don't get it , What exactly ln -s does?
It makes symbolic links ( shortcuts ) to files, it does the same thing that right clicking a file in nautilus and choosing "make link" does, but in the terminal instead of the GUI
... Coool , thank you, I will read the manual of ln... "man ln" right?
Yes
And remember that you want a symbolic link, not a regular link, regular links are not quite the same as shortcuts and can cause interesting problems if you don't understand them
